commit.message:
Replace xmalloc and xrealloc with malloc and realloc

This prevents the case of the plugin accessing symbols that bash can't
resolve.

tree 6e0708a806b7575323fd047d938ff8e35e08f0ec

Replace xmalloc and xrealloc with malloc and realloc

This prevents the case of the plugin accessing symbols that bash can't
resolve.

commit.message:
Check for execute_cmd.h

Ubuntu's bash-builtins package does not install execute_cmd.h even
though it does install all of the other header files needed by
MPI-Bash.

verification.payload:
tree 4b1e50ecab45c90415f64fb23b7b1925fa0dd240
parent 83aaefa8a083f1898bc6298be903372546f691da
author Scott Pakin <pakin@lanl.gov> 1706825116 -0700
committer Scott Pakin <pakin@lanl.gov> 1706825116 -0700

Check for execute_cmd.h

Ubuntu's bash-builtins package does not install execute_cmd.h even
though it does install all of the other header files needed by
MPI-Bash.

commit.message:
Update MPI usage in the README.md file

* Recommend mpiexec instead of mpirun.
* Include `mpi_finalize` in the code example.  (Otherwise, Open MPI
  complains.)

verification.payload:
tree 9b2c6bfce323df1608d8546c638399ea833e5d52
parent 318e8cf4491c7cc9ffa329f237b375775eee2fe4

Update MPI usage in the README.md file

* Recommend mpiexec instead of mpirun.
* Include `mpi_finalize` in the code example.  (Otherwise, Open MPI
  complains.)

commit.message:
circle-init: Avoid implicit declaration of execute_shell_function

By including "execute_cmd.h".  This prevents a build failure
with future compilers which do not support implicit function
declarations by default.

Replace deprecated MPI_Errhandler_set with newer MPI_Comm_set_errhandler

Resolves #17.

commit.message:
Generate scripts, honoring --program-suffix

Fixes #11

Document that MPI-Bash requires Bash 4.3+

Resolves #10
Bumped version from 1.2 to 1.3
Refer MPI_Init failures to issue #6
Made "issue #9" a hyperlink

Reference Linux packages in installation instructions

Also, the installation instructions have been moved from README.md to
a new INSTALL.md.

Use pkg-config to look for bash only as a last resort

The new sequence for searching for a bash header-file directory is

1. --with-bashdir
2. bash* in the current directory
3. pkg-config
